reviews.text: Delicioooooso! La comida es increible, el servicio inigualable!
Very tasty food and nice presentation. I asked about allergy related issues and they were helpfulüòä
Great food
Really yummy food! Our favorite was the sushi hand roll set and the crispy rice with salmon. The service was good and the staff was really friendly!
Try something new, everything is good, will come back soon!

The food is good.
Decent spot for Pan-Asian options.
Fast service, amazing food! I always come here for special occasions and it never disappoints! Such amazing and high quality sushi can‚Äôt be found this easily üòã

Really nice food
Food was tasty, service was nice, and the restaurant was very clean. Our family had a great time!
Very nice dragon roll, i reccomend getting the tonkastu ramen.

I LOVED the food here, I ordered the hot lady roll, the salmon literally melted when I sent it in my mouth, the desert I ordered was the crispy cheese cake also absolutely amazing. Food was very appetizing and appealing looking. The only unsatisfying part was the wait time, at first my order came out very quickly in about 5-10 minutes, BUT when I wanted to order more it took almost 40 minutes for me to get my order, and they even got one of my sushi mixed up! But other than that it was great, would come again.

This restaurant is a really really good find. We order the food extremely quickly using a tablet and within seconds of having ordered the food a waiter arrived to confirm the order. I‚Äôve never been so impressed. They also serve you complimentary tea and keep filling up your cup. Furthermore the portions were delicious and generous.

I  went to Asea Restaurant and had a great time. The place was clean and quiet, and the workers were kind. I ordered the Devil Sushi Roll, and it was very tasty and a little spicy. The sushi was fresh and looked nice on the plate. The food came fast, and I didn‚Äôt have to wait long. I will go back again because I really liked it.

Great food and great service!

The food was excellent and it was all a very good price. they had excellent portions and i felt very full after ordering 4 rolls for myself. They also have great value deals on the lunch menu so make sure to check thay out. I would come here again

Good fusion of southeast Asian and Japanese cuisine. I recommend the miso ramen and especially the chicken katsu. The spicy udon was just the right spice. It gave it some kick, but not overpowering. The only downside is it didn't have bok choy üòû
Food taste good! Once a while, Waitress will come to care for you, ask if need anything.
Âë≥ÈÅì‰∏çÈîôÔºå‰∏ãÊ¨°ËøòÊù•
Came back a second time cause this place is amazing. Food is always great.
Food and services was absolutely great! Must eat here!
I order here often and eat in. Always fresh and delicious. Good, reliable standby.
Place is great food is great. I definitely recommend this place.

Disappointing.
The food isn't that good. The nigiri sushi pieces are very scrawny and not that flavorful. The sushi dinner is overpriced in light of how little food it is. The special rolls are just ok. The dumplings are just ok, and they brought us the wrong kind (we ordered veggie and they brought seafood). The one good thing was the sushi appetizer - an avocado bowl sort of thing with sashimi chunks inside.
The service was very slow and inattentive. I had to ask more than once for things. The staff kept apologizing and brought us a free appetizer because the service was so slow.
I would say that the atmosphere was good but they had the low-class giant TVs on behind the sushi bar - distracting and unavoidable to the eyes from anywhere in the restaurant unless you and all your dining companions sit on one side of the table. facing away from the sushi bar, which is uncomfortable for conversation. Also I like to face the sushi bar and watch the chefs work - it's a big part of the fun of eating sushi. With a little bit of effort this place could be great. Maybe it used to be - I don't know.
Finally, I will never, ever give 5 stars to a restaurant which has you pay the bill on a tablet and has the tip amounts listed as starting at 18%. 15% is the correct tip for satisfactory service in a restaurant. The software-based up-sell to 18% is offensive.
The service here was way less than satisfactory, yet I'm supposed to leave 18%? Not a chance. Bring me a paper receipt and let me calculate my own tip...
Very good price and good food

Nice~

Basil fried rice - spicy & good
Japanese beer - authentic rich & full of flavor !
Placed a pickup order and it was ready super fast. Sushi tasted great and was fresh. Really reasonably priced as well. No complaints at all!
Best sushi on town
Sushi was fresh and so yummy. Oyster was so delicious! Will come back again!! Ambiance was so nice and the servers are really nice and friendly!

Hate writing this, because I loved this place for years- but the quality has gone so low I can‚Äôt order here anymore. It‚Äôs probably not the chefs btw because the staff is nice, but to the owner:

The sashimi is now paper thin and smallll. It says you get x amount of pieces, but you can see how paper thin this is. Tuna and salmon pieces are barely even bite sized üëé

And now the shrimp tempura, $9 for 2 pieces of thinnnn thin little shrimp, and it‚Äôs not even deveined ? ü§¢

No thanks

‚≠êÔ∏èüç±üç£ I visit this place quite often, and it has become one of my favorite sushi spots in Sunset Park. The portions are generous, and the prices are very reasonable, making it a great value for the quality you receive. The food is always fresh, and the service is consistently friendly and attentive. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable and enjoyable sushi experience in the area.
my wife‚Äòs favorite sushi restaurant at this area, the oyster is very fresh and tasty. All the fish in the box are delicious and fresh. The service is good too. We will come back.

Came here with family and friends for a get-together and we had a wonderful experience.

Love love love this place! Service was amazing, the staff is very attentive throughout the dinner. The sushi is fresh and everything tasted amazing. Lots of vegetarian options well and I think they have a good variety to choose from. Highly recommend as one of the best sushi spots in Brooklyn, specifically near Sunset Park.

I came here with my mom and her co-workers very often. The service was great; the staff were super kind and greeted us with four cups of warm tea. The interior was very nice. The sashimi was so fresh that my mom had to order another plate.
Beautiful interior, food was fast, service was great as well. Ordered some rolls and they were delicious! The pizza appetizer was one of my favorites.

My family and I order from Asea often for takeaway, and we love their food. Today we decided to sit down inside and the quality of the food was just as excellent as always. The service was great and our server was attentive and kind. Thank you for a great meal and time!

The portions are really good for the price. Everything we ordered was phenomenal. I had the Malaysian iced coffee and left me wanting to bring a whole jar back home. The dancing lobster sushi was amazing and so was the hibachi chicken. Plus they had special when you spend a certain amount you get a free item from 3 choices. We opted for the mochi green tea which was also amazing. Could recommend this place to anyone. Will definitely come back!

Chuck was amazing at attending us and brought good vibesüëå

The restaurant has a modern design with a cozy, welcoming atmosphere. The seating arrangement was comfortable
The sushi was fresh and beautifully presented. They also had a great selection of drinks.
The pricing was reasonable worth it for the quality of the sushi.
I would highly recommend this sushi restaurant for anyone looking for authentic gourmet and fresh sushi in the area. Whether you're a sushi enthusiast or new to it, this place has something to offer for everyone.

This year, my friends and I spent Christmas in Brooklyn‚Äôs 8th Avenue area, and of course, food and drinks were a must! We decided to try Asea Fusion, known for its sashimi, sushi, and creative dishes. The open kitchen was a highlight‚Äîyou can watch the chefs work with fresh ingredients, giving it an omakase-like vibe. It was such a satisfying experience!

üåü Must-Try Dishes
1Ô∏è‚É£ Asea Sashimi: A luxurious nine-grid sashimi platter. Each section was a delight! The standout items were the gold-flaked uni oyster and the quail egg with caviar in the center‚Äîsuper fresh and packed with flavor.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Yellowtail App: Thinly sliced yellowtail with a special sauce. It melts in your mouth and tastes even better with the sauce.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Asea Toro App: Thick-cut tuna belly, rich and fatty. A perfect starter.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Korean BBQ Beef Short Ribs: Tender and juicy short ribs with a hint of Korean BBQ sweetness. Absolutely delicious and highly recommended.
5Ô∏è‚É£ Pyramid: A crispy and flavorful snack, perfect as a pairing with drinks.
6Ô∏è‚É£ Hot Sake (Large): A must-have for a cold winter evening in NYC. Enjoying this warm sake with friends was heartwarming and perfectly complemented the fresh dishes.

üç£ Summary:
The ingredients here are incredibly fresh, and every dish is beautifully plated, rivaling omakase standards. The nine-grid sashimi platter was especially impressive, offering a visual and culinary treat. Whether you‚Äôre here for a gathering, a date, or dining solo, this spot is a fantastic choice. Highly recommend checking it out!

I‚Äôve been coming here for years on notable family gatherings and events. The food has been consistently good and the service has continued to be fantastic. The wait to get in is usually short to none, highly recommend coming here.
They have excellent food, excellent service, the place is very friendly and very clean. I recommend it 100%
They offered us a dessert for posting a review  specifically  5 stars, after posting the review they didn't give us anything.

This place is an absolute gem, they are very sweet, kind, and comfortable. The environment was calm and quiet with adorable decor. The food was delicious, all of it wonderfully presented along with being just warm enough to eat the second it came out. Our waitress was very kind and made sure we were comfortable the whole time. Most definitely a five star place and will keep coming back.

I found this store by accident, their food surprise me. Very fresh fish, and delicious. They also have very good service. Their waiters and waitresses are friendly and patient. NO.1 recommend Japanese restaurant
Fantastic lunch special! Got the 3 roll lunch with salad and it was a good amount of food for a great price. Definitely worth the visit!

Wow, The food here is amazing! I happened to pass by and found this restaurant today, and I was blown away by the food. My standards for Japanese cuisine have gone up, and there's no turning back. I will definitely recommend this place to more friends and family. Good things should be shared with friends.
Asea is the perfect place for a late night, where you can find quality food, quality service all for a great price! We love coming here and definitely always look forward to coming back.

Every thing was great, from service to the food.
Every bite was delicious.
We had some of the specials and some menu items, every time we come they have new things to try.

Really great spot with an unbearable lunch special. $10.50 for 3 rolls is basically a steal & the choices you get are vast. All ingredients taste fresh and overall delicious. Make sure to get the Lychee ice drink, you won‚Äôt regret it. The service was lovely and all staff members were welcoming. Absolutely recommend!

After coming here once in a while, it comes with a load of expectations for this restaurant, though this visit is a special one. We've known this restaurant for both their sashimis and main dishes, but an exchange of chefs have only elevated this restaurant even more. You'd imagine that the fatty tuna, along with the beef liver, wouldn't be exuding a great scent. Not only does it have a great scent, the rice today harmonized with the fish itself. The clam soup could've never been better, with every one of my family members claiming it as their favorite dish of the day. All this to say, this place is a must try. After eating at so many Asian fusion restaurants, this return has made my next the more anticipated.

Sad I have to put them out there like this, but this experience was beyond repair. Service took 10 minutes to get us drinks and 45 minutes to bring out 3 sushi rolls. Just look at the picture of the rolls and you tell me if it looks appetizing. I even told them the salmon roll was not fresh and they said "ok" and proceeded to leave it on the bill. There's so much good sushi in Brooklyn, just move on.

Quiet and cozy neighborhood spot. Friendly staff. Decent food.

Will return to try their new omakase dishes that we got a sneak-peak of (pictures included).
Great experience! Service is great and the food is so good. 10/10 will come again. I wish I could give 10 stars
Very nice place. Food is fresh .my kids they enjoy the food customer service is nice.
Great food and service! Love the attention to detail and presentation! Would highly recommend a stop here if you‚Äôre nearby!

I been coming here for years. The atmosphere  the food are amazing.

Highly recommended to friends and family ‚ú®

I‚Äôve been eating here since around the time they opened, i believe it was around 2012. The food is great, ambiance is beautiful, and service is wonderful. Brought my 3 year old here today and our waitress made her chopsticks fitting her little hands. She loved them and decided to take them home after her meal ü§£ keep doing great business! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Great staff, atmosphere and great food. The prices are beyond reasonable for NYC. This is my second time here and I'll definitely be back!
